Scene Setup.description: These functions should be sent at the start of the simulation. They advance the simulation by 1 frame and `Magnebot.state` will reflect the state of that frame.

Movement.description: These functions move or turn the Magnebot. These functions advance the simulation by many frames, depending on the nature of the action. `Magnebot.state` will reflect the simulation state at the final frame.

Arm Articulation.description: These functions move and bend the joints of the Magnebots's arms. These functions advance the simulation by many frames, depending on the nature of the action. `Magnebot.state` will reflect the simulation state at the final frame.

Misc..description: These are utility functions that won't advance the simulation by any frames.

Low-level.description: These are low-level functions that you are unlikely to ever need to use.
